tenure.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the right to stay permanently in a teaching job
tenure.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: It’s becoming increasingly difficult to acquire academic tenure.
tenure.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the period of time when someone has an important job
tenure.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The company has doubled in value during his tenure.
tenure.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the legal right to live in a house or use a piece of land for a period of time
tenure.translation[1].definitions[0].def: the period of time when someone has an important job or position
tenure.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: During his four-year tenure as president, the firm’s annual revenue rose dramatically.
tenure.translation[1].definitions[1].def: the right to stay permanently in a job, for example a teaching job in a university
tenure.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: the life tenure of judges at the State Courts
tenure.translation[1].definitions[2].def: the legal right to live in a house or use a piece of land
